headline.main: Suicide of a Merchant on Broadway.

docs.lead_paragraph: WILLIAM H. WETMORE, ?? resided in the house of Mrs. CORNELIA CLAR?? No. 724 Broadway, committed suicide early ?? Saturday morning by cutting his throat with a ??, while ?? is believed) laboring under a fit of ??aporary insanity, caused by erysipclatous inflam?? communicating with the membrances of the brain. The deceased was a merchant.

docs.lead_paragraph: MUNICIPAL RASOALTIES.--We have never winced under the terrible epithets which some of our provincial neighbors have occasionally bestowed upon New-York ; and when it has been called the metropolis of vice, and our Municipal government been held up as a model of villany, we have not ventured to resent the offensive judgments pronounced,

headline.main: THE FRENCH POLICE.; Organization, Duties and General Description of the French Police.

docs.lead_paragraph: Are you in reality the greatest grumblers in the world, or is your Police the worst in the world? That you go once a year to the polls and vote yourselves invariably the same Police, the same insecurity of life and property, the same garroting, head-splitting, pocket-picking system, shows that your grumbling is animmonse rumbling of hollow sounds

headline.main: KANSAS MATTERS.; From the St. Louis Democrat. SENTIMENTS OF THE PEOPLE OF KANSAS. Views and Opinions as the Democratic Press, PROCEEDINGS OF THE FREE STATE MEN.

docs.lead_paragraph: A meeting of the citizens of Lawrence was held on the evening of the 10th inst. The meeting was organized by the election of Gen. E. B. WHITMAN, Chairman, and NORMAN ALLEN, Esq., Secretary. General LANE, being introduced to the meeting, took the stand, and made one of his most able and eloquent speeches. At his conclusion, the Chair appointed a Committee on Resolutions, consisting of the following gentlemen:

docs.lead_paragraph: HORRIBLE SPECTACLE IN THE SUNKEN RUSSIAN MAN-OF-WAR.--Towards the end of last month by order of the Russian Government, the Russian vessel-of-the-line Lefort, of whose foundering in the Gulf of Finland, with 1,400 men on board, we had a report at the time, was searched for, found and examined by English divers, brought ?? for the purpose. se.

headline.main: The Philadelphia Board of Health Frauds.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the Bulletin of Friday evening. The announcement in yesterday's Bulletin of the discovery of Health of this city, must have prepared our readers for the exposure made in the City Councils.
docs.snippet: From the Bulletin of Friday evening. The announcement in yesterday's Bulletin of the discovery of Health of this city, must have prepared our readers for the exposure made in the City Councils.

docs.lead_paragraph: EXTRAORDINARY DEVELOPMENTS IN REGARD TO THE BOARD OF HEALTH OF PHILADELPHIA--FORGERY AND SWINDLING. From the Philadelphia Evening Bulletin, Thursday. It is known to most of our readers that the Finance Committee of Councils has been lately investigating the business of the Board of Health of this city, with reference to some embezzlements and other offences which it was supposed had been committed by some of its members.
docs.abstract: Frauds in the Board of Health

docs.lead_paragraph: MEYERREER'S Opera of "Robert to Diable" will be given to-night for the third time. OPERA IN HAVENA. MARETZEE and his company have commenced operations in Havana. The house was crowded from pit dome, and the enthuslasm was unbounded. The opera selected for the occasion was "Lucrezia Borgia," Madame GAZZANICA playing her principal role. Her success appears to have been enormous.

docs.lead_paragraph: ARRIVAL OF EX-PRESIDENT PIERCE AT NORFOLK.--Ex-President PIERCE, with his estimate lady, arrived in our city yesterday morning, after a pleasant trip down the Chesapeake in the steamer North Carolina. He was welcomed by a national salute from the receiving-ship Pennsylvania, and a salute from the Norfolk Light Artillery Blues, Capt. CORPREW.

docs.lead_paragraph: Col. FORNEY'S Press of yesterday has the following: "The Governor of Kansas reached Philadelphia yesterday noon, and is the guest of his relative, ST. GEORGE. TUCKER CAMPBELL, Governor WALKER leaves for New-York this morning, and will be with us again in a few days. He is in great health and spirits, and fully and entirely committed to the doctrine of popular sovereignty, and to the principle that the will of the majority shall prevail.
